alert.note: Alert for Mason (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued November 11 at 6:20AM PST until November 11 at 9:05PM PST by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Seattle WA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Washington... Skokomish River At Potlatch affecting Mason County. .Heavy rain continues to fall over the Olympic Peninsula this morning as a strong front moves east across the area. For the Olympic Peninsula Region...including Potlatch...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Skokomish River at Potlatch. * WHEN...Until late this evening. * IMPACTS...At 16.5 feet, the Skokomish River will cause widespread flooding of pasture lands, with water flowing quickly over West Bourgault Road and Skokomish Valley Road. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:00 AM PST Saturday the stage was 16.2 feet. - Flood stage is 16.5 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage this morning and crest around 16.7 feet later today. It will then fall below flood stage by tonight, reaching 15.7 feet late Sunday. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 16.5 feet on 01/07/2007. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by this afternoon at 230 PM PST.
